formalMetadata.description: A page with a German sentence that contains an English acronym. The English expansion of the acronym is provided in the title attribute of the acronym element, which also has a lang attribute with the value "uk" instead of "en" for English. ("uk" is the language code for Ukrainian.)
formalMetadata.title: Incorrect language identification for English acronym in German text
formalMetadata.dc:creator: Christophe.Strobbe@esat.kuleuven.be

recommendation.label: XHTML™ 1.0 The Extensible HyperText Markup Language (Second Edition)

testElement.specReference: Specifying the language of content: the lang attribute

purpose.p: This test case is intended to fail because the language of the (English) expansion of the acronym is not correctly identified.

expertGuidance.p: Check whether the change in natural language for the title-attribute of the acronym-element is correctly identified.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser cannot determine the natural language of the acronym in the document.

techComment.p: The acronym should have a lang attribute with value "en" instead of "uk" (Ukrainian).
This test case maps to technique H58: Using the lang attribute to identify changes in the natural language (http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/WD-WCAG20-TECHS-20060427/Overview.html#H58) but fails.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser cannot determine the natural language of the acronym in the document.

techComment.p: The acronym should have a lang attribute with value "en" instead of "uk" (Ukrainian).
